clinical_study.brief_title: Multicenter Evaluation of Children and Young Adults With Genotype Positive Long QT Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Evaluation of Children and Young Adults With Genotype Positive Long QT Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: Mednax Center for Research, Education, Quality and Safety

clinical_study.source: Mednax Center for Research, Education, Quality and Safety

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to provide comprehensive follow-up in patients with Long QT Syndrome (LQTS) and gain additional information regarding genotype-phenotype correlation and effective management and treatment options.

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse Cardiac Events on patients with genotype positive LQT1 who have a normal EKG and absence of symptoms, but a molecular confirmation of LQT1.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Enrollment is expected to take approximately 5 years. The patients will be followed until they are no longer cared for by a pediatric cardiology facility (typically post-college) or approximately 21 years of age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Cardiac Events on patients with both phenotype and genotype positive.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Enrollment is expected to take approximately 5 years. The patients will be followed until they are no longer cared for by a pediatric cardiology facility (typically post-college) or approximately 21 years of age.

study_pop.textblock: Children and Young Adults with Genotype Positive Long QT Syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children and/or young adults diagnosed with heterogeneous repolarization disorder who have genotype positive Long QT, or
- Newly diagnosed mutation positive patients with a confirmed test
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children who are phenotypically positive with no molecular testing
- Children that are phenotypically positive but genotype negative
